alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 7:40PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. .No rain is forecast for the next several days and this should allow rivers to begin to slowly recede over the next week. For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 21.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EDT Thursday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.6 feet on 01/01/1912. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Peace River Arcadia at SR 7 11.0 21.3 Thu 6 pm 22.3 19.9 18.8 18.4 18.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 10 AM EDT.
